title: (31500) Tudela - 34 Calle Padre Ubillos
description: Beautiful park to visit and have an old-fashioned picnic, relaxing under a tree.

title: (31500) Tudela - 4 Calle Subida al Monumento
description: We came to visit the Sacred Heart of Jesus to see the views of Tudela, we found the parking lot empty and we stayed to eat. Very good views of Tudela, there is shade and a source of drinking water. I don't know if you can sleep.

title: (31500) Tudela - 89 Paseo del Cristo
description: Free parking, quiet and close to the city center. Next to the banks of the Ebro.

title: (31500) Tudela - 21 Calle de los Auroros
description: Along the sidewalk, in the street which is quiet during the day, there is a square, Mercadona and Dia, which are a few hundred meters away. 1.2 km from the cathedral.

title: (31500) Tudela - 4 NA-126
description: At the entrance to the town of Tudela, vacant lot on the banks of the Ebro. No table available but enough room to settle ..

title: (31500) Tudela - C. Guillermo de Tudela
description: Generally quiet, especially during the week, the best views of Tudela and its surroundings, Moncayo, the Pyrenees, etc... without services.

title: (31500) Tudela - 14B Paseo Pamplona
description: Dirt parking next to the river, a quiet place to sleep, although on weekends it fills up with cars. It must be taken into account if the river rises, park only on the paved upper one, if there are no river rises, the ground floor parking lot is better and quieter. There is a tapas bar near Casa Alberto and it has a great menu.

title: (31500) Tudela - 2 Avenida Zaragoza
description: Automatic laundry, inside the commercial passage. the surrounding streets are pedestrianized so it is not possible to access directly with the motorhome. While the laundry is done you can walk around the surroundings, which are beautiful, have a skewer, etc.

title: (31500) Tudela -
description: When we saw the nearby motorhome area ... we fled! And this is paradise! A huge flat car park with trees, not too isolated! We spent a dream quiet night!

title: (31500) Tudela - Avenida Argentina
description: Good motorhome for overnight stay. Quiet and with a slope that can be easily corrected with the position of the motorhome. recommend very good bar and patisserie called Trigo Dulce 5 minutes walk in Av de la Argentina well worth a visit. But aire gets very busy.

title: (31500) Tudela - 26 Avenida de las Merindades
description: Behind the cemetery, flat place, next to the road but shaded with trees.

title: (31500) Tudela -
description: Parking next to the public football stadium, for the night, no service but close to the city center within 10 minutes, a few trucks parked

title: (31500) Tudela - 47D Avenida del Barrio
description:
La lavenderia del barrio Laundry. Open daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m.
Coffee maker, bench in front of the laundry and sorting bin and water tap.
Free parking spaces (for smaller vehicles) are available in the white zones of the surrounding streets.

title: (31500) Tudela - Av. del Barrio
description: LAUNDRY

title: (31500) Tudela - 10 Avenida Instituto
description: Large dirt parking lot where there are trucks parked. Behind the Alcampo supermarket, and a laundry opposite the supermarket. We ate, shopped and washed.

title: (31500) Tudela -
description: Widely spaced motorway service area, free toilets and showers available. Carwash, electrical terminals and access to drinking water. Gas and butane for stoves for sale. Small restaurant.

title: (31500) Tudela - Km 3 Carretera de Tarazona
description: Free water at the service station

title: (31500) Tudela - 9 Calle Canal de Navarra
description: Large quiet parking

title: (31500) Tudela - Autovía del Ebro
description: Parking lot of a large supermarket, being very tired we decided to stop for 1 night which went very well and then join bardenas. The road makes noise and the place is not necessarily ideal but allows you to rest and enjoy the WC, shop and petrol station in the early morning.

title: (31512) Fontellas - 30 Carretera el Bocal
description: Great parking alongside the canal. Wide open space. Pretty footpath and walks nearby. Very calm and peaceful.  Much easier to park here than the car park 2km down the road which was overflowing easter weekend.  Accès road very easy for camping car despite its gravel appearance. Small road nearby for access to Tudela by mountain bike , 7km.

title: (31512) Fontellas - Autopista Vasco-Aragonesa
description: Rest area located on the AP-68 motorway (same rest area in both directions) 24 hour service with a small supermarket. You have to pay for the showers. No drain and electricity services. We spent a very quiet night on the way to Catalunya. Perfect to spend the night.

title: (31521) Murchante - Autopista Vasco-Aragonesa
description: Highway rest area with parking in line. Some swings and small trees. It is at the foot of the highway, so there will be a lot of noise at night.

title: (31500) Tudela - NA-134
description: Large rest area / picnic, sheltered tables. Large parking away from the road (follow path), quiet and discreet. Possibility to sleep at least one night (see more, we have not seen anyone). No service. Ideal as a crossing spot. Welcome to the far west!

title: () Fontellas - Calle Barranco
description: Parking of El Bocal, considered place of Cultural Interest of the Imperial Canal of Aragon.

name: Área de autocaravanas Cabanillas
title: (31511) Área de autocaravanas Cabanillas
description:
Motorhome rest area from July 18, 2023. Fully equipped. 15 well-leveled pitches. Drainage of gray and black water.
Aqueduct with "tokens" but the town hall has decided to leave the service free. The electricity service is not yet operational.
Neighborhood very well lit at night and quiet. The area is integrated into a park with several picnic tables. It has several bins and containers.

title: (31500) Tudela - Polígono Industrial
description: 2 washing machines and 1 dryer next to the gas station. Small playground in the restaurant garden. Must Ask for shower key at the gas station counter

title: (31511) Cabanillas - Unnamed Road
description: Peaceful place in the middle of nature, trees with good shade, in the absence of some benches.

title: (31521) Murchante -
description: Location at the edge of the lake, small parking lot under the pine trees, we put our camper van on the dirt area on the right. In the fresh air. Pleasant pebble lakeside.

title: (31521) Murchante -
description: Away from the road, on the edge of a small lake. Very quiet corner.

title: (31511) Cabanillas - 3A Calle la Vicera
description: Center town we spent the night without problem. Playground for children, wifi area, garbage cans, no service. Located 200 meters from the start near the cemetery of the transhumance path that crosses the Bardenas to Ejeo. In the center bakery, grocery store open only in the morning, pharmacy, baà.

title: (31500) Tudela - Camino las Bardenas Reales
description: We spent a superb night in this wild place overlooking the Bardenas reales, in the middle of the fields with a breathtaking view of the bardenas reales a few steps away and the possibility of putting a table and chairs on top of the rock. for the point of view.

title: (31500) - Unnamed Road
description: Very nice places for a night away from everything with a superb view of the bardenas. Dirt track and pebbles for two vehicles maximum.

name: Oil Artajo SL
title: (31512) Oil Artajo SL
description: Private area located within the estate of aceiteartajo, producers of extra virgin olive oil. It is necessary to book in advance in the website, in the section 'Autocaravanas'.  (website visible for park4night PRO users). It has black and grey waste water recreational area with tables, and a free guides tour to the state and oil mill. It's not allowed to camp (with shade canopy, tables and chairs). It's forbidden to light fires.

title: (31520) Cascante - 36 Avenida la Constitución
description: Ground parking next to the old Cascante train station. Ideal to leave the motorhome and start the green route with a ticket to Tarazona or Tudela.

title: (31500) Murillo de las Limas -
description: Place in the middle of nature near the track but without passage

title: (31520) Cascante - 6 Avenida la Constitución
description: Parking at the entrance of the city, ideal even for large motorhomes

title: (31500) Murillo de las Limas -
description: Place for 2 vehicles set back from the road. Absolute tranquility and magnificent view. Accessible to camper type templates. Earthy ground so be careful in rainy weather… No service. 4G works pretty well.

title: (31520) Cascante - 36 Avenida Fundación Fuentes Dutor
description: Quiet area next to the thermoludic. It's a public parking; there are no specific places for Rv but it is enabled. The police have passed several times. Insurance. Ideal to rest one night. 7 km away from the AP 68.

title: (31550) Ribaforada -
description: Lieu sympa en pleine nature, à l’abris du vent et de la route.

title: (31513) Arguedas - 21 Calle Raimundo Lanas
description: Parking esplanade in front of the entrance to the Municipal Pools and soccer field.

title: (31510) Fustiñana - NA-5202
description: In the heart of nature on the edge of the Ebro. Coming from Festinana direction Ribaforada, just before the bridge, go down right at the edge of the Ebro, then go under the bridge. Track and green area accessible to vans and vans. Quiet, shady, protected from the wind. No service. Very good for a wild night.

title: (31550) Ribaforada - Autovía del Ebro
description: Parking area day and night, usually used by truck drivers, without services for motorhomes, there is gas station and restaurant; we dined and slept here without problems, so we follow route the next morning.

title: (31513) Arguedas - Calle de las Bardenas
description: Esplanade of land. Many other motorhomes. Close to the sevices area.

title: (31513) Arguedas - 65 Calle Val
description:
The emptying point is located 50 meters from the car park. With gray and black water outlet. Advantage: very close to Bardenas desert.
View of the cliff dwellings, but walk along the path in front of the houses slightly towards the city, these are worth a visit. Village is not much but bakery and small spruce 750 meters. Good food at bar-restaurant Mallen. In the courtyard in the center. Bulls through the city at Easter....

title: (31513) Arguedas - Parque Senda Viva
description: Near Arguedas, above the solar farm, flat by the way. Magnificent view all around, rosemary scent, absolute silence. Exposed to the wind, no facilities. Recommendation for self-sufficient vehicles that can handle the first rather steep and bumpy ascent.

title: (31513) Arguedas - 39 Calle Carlos Arias
description: Calm and quiet night despite the proximity of the road, opposite the restaurant, cleaner than the gravel parking lot in the city center when the parking lot for motorhomes is full or when you want to be alone and quiet.

title: (31510) Cabanillas - Camino las Bardenas Reales
description: In the heart of the wind farm of the bandera, small space for a van next to a few small shrubs. Quiet (but not wind turbines) and beautiful view. 20 minutes from tudela.

title: (31590) Castejón - 3 Camino Cementerio
description:
It is a very comfortable area in which you hardly have to deviate from the national highway and very accessible for motorhomes of all sizes, since it is right at the entrance of the town.

It has all the filling and emptying services for black and gray water.
Maximum stay 72 hours.
It is located in a quiet and well lit place.

It is next to a park with a green area, a skate park and a free covered pediment. It is also next to an area with several rural walks.

It is very close to several shops, a bakery, a laundry, sports facilities
with gym, indoor and outdoor pools, saunas, jacuzzis, etc. and an adventure activities company.

There is a container at the end of the square, near the entrance to the pediment, which is sometimes difficult to see because it is covered by the trucks that park on the esplanade.

The town has a gas station, several ATMs and all kinds of services, in addition you can visit a museum, an energy classroom, a winery, etc.

title: (31510) Fustiñana - Polígono Ganadero
description: At the top of a hill at the corner of a chapel, a gravel parking lot gives you a view of the desert from a car / mountain bike trail to visit the park (you will also have a view on the other side of animal breeding farms). Night authorized. 4G excellent.

title: (31513) Arguedas -
description: Right next to the Sandaviva park and at the gates of the Bardenas desert. Pitch on the edge of a small path, for 4 vans or motorhomes. Very quiet and flat. Perfect for 1 night.

title: (31513) Arguedas -
description: Small square on a hill, next to a large parking lot with a view of Navarra and Balenares

title: (31500) Valtierra - Camino las Bardenas Reales
description: Splendid spot far from popular spots

name: Estacionamiento de autocaravanas
title: (31513) Estacionamiento de autocaravanas
description: motorhome area with video surveillance inside the senda viva park with the option to book in advance, somewhat uneven but very safe and quiet.

title: (31513) Arguedas - Parque Senda Viva
description: Parking of the park, possibility of spending the night without charge. It is recommended to arrive before the opening of the park or after the closing (10 places more or less)

title: (31513) Arguedas - Cam. las Bardenas Reales
description: Stunning 360° view, totally invisible from the road. Be careful, exposed to the wind, and to be avoided in rainy weather, the access track can become greasy. I advise against large motorhomes.

title: (31550) Ribaforada - Autovía del Ebro
description: Rest area with picnic tables and barbecues.

title: (31500) Cabaña de Pericote -
description:
Access after only 100m of road. To locate you, there is a good fire just in front of the spot.
Leaving the NA-125 I did not see any signs, so maybe this side of the road is not in the park and it is possible to spend the night? (I would have needed a card)
I saw mountain bikes, cars, a converted van... Maybe it's a track or even a shortcut because I saw a 39T truck go by at full speed!!
No telephone network.

title: (31513) Arguedas - Camino las Bardenas Reales
description: Park information center car park. Quiet and clean for several motorhomes. Forbidden to stay the night.

title: (31514) Valtierra - 2D Calle Santa Cruz
description: New, clean, asphalted and lighted parking space. There is free gray and black water disposal. Fresh water can also be refilled free of charge. Two shower rooms with toilet are also available (free of charge). A fee of €2/token applies for electricity if required. Seating available. Outdoor swimming pool nearby. City within walking distance. Trash cans are missing. (Please take rubbish with you!).

title: (31522) Monteagudo - 12 Avenida de San Agustín
description: Parking in the main street that leads to the city center, busy, large parking spaces

title: (31514) Valtierra -
description: Perfect to spend the night without noise. On the esplanade next to the water treatment plant. The final road is narrow and there is a good slope, I do not recommend it for large vehicles. A local person told me that on weekends young people usually come to have a bottle, so it is less recommended on Fridays and Saturdays.

title: (31522) Monteagudo - 100A Lugar Zona Residencial
description: Simple picnic area with just a table and a trash can with enough to park your vehicle. In troubleshooting because nothing nice

title: (31591) Corella - NA-6810
description: Access by way of land remains practicable for any type of vehicle. Good place for a picnic break or to spend the night. Trash can disposal picnic table in bad condition. No shade access to a walk around the lake but swimming is prohibited because of the factories around.

title: (31514) Valtierra - 39 Paseo del Castillo
description: Two little shaded picnic tables on the side of a tarmac path just after the municipal swimming pool in Valtierra. High site at the foot of pine mountains.

title: (31514) Valtierra - 11 Paseo del Castillo
description: After shooting for quite a while, we came across this nice spot: the terrain is flat, the view is clear, there are trees to provide some shade.

title: (31513) Arguedas - Cam. las Bardenas Reales
description: Great place for a night very close to Bardenas Reales Nature Reserve! Spectacular scenery! A two cars drove by, otherwise quiet. There is even a small sign with a "P" on it :)

title: (31522) Monteagudo - Unnamed Road
description: In the shade of the pines, a dozen picnic tables. Water court and vineyards nearby. No traffic.

title: (31514) Valtierra - Polígono Industrial Valtierra-Arguedas
description: Perfect place to sleep. 2 nights early June, no traffic, very quiet, no services, small forest nearby

title: (31513) Arguedas - Camino las Bardenas Reales
description: In the midst of nature. To do bike routes etc.

title: (31591) Corella - 17 Calle Araceli
description: Public parking There is a market on Wednesdays. It's behind the civil guard post. There were parked trucks occupying several places. We were in January.

title: (31540) Buñuel - 1 Polígono Industrial de Buñuel Calle C
title_short: (31540) Buñuel - 1 Polígono Industrial de Buñuel Calle C
description: Area to stop and eat at El Polígono Restaurants with the possibility of a shower for 2 eur.

address.street: 1 Polígono Industrial de Buñuel Calle C

title: (31513) Arguedas - Parque Senda Viva
description: Near the desert of Bardenas / Inn / barbecue. Possibility at the hostel

title: (31510) Fustiñana - Camino las Bardenas Reales
description:
Parking possible on the side of the path, after bend, on the heights of Bardenas. Beautiful 360 degree view. Last small climb with large pebble (not even 10 meters).
It is not allowed to sleep in the park.

title: (31513) Arguedas - Parque Senda Viva
description: Parking without services. Magnificent panorama.

title: (31591) Corella - 12-14 Calle Arrabal
description: Parking near the public city center

title: (31514) Valtierra - NA-8712
description: Nice place in the countryside. We stopped for a few moments to get some water (no drinking water!). Located between two main streets that are busy during the day, but for one night, it's definitely ok! You can travel easily, even with a large travel vehicle. Immediately near Bardenas Reales (semi-desert) - a very interesting trip!

title: (31591) Corella - 11 Calle Baños
description: Free motorhome area except water refill 1 token /100 liters. There is no information on where to get the token!! 5 minutes from the city center with a baroque road and a wine and restaurant area. Thank you Corella Town Hall

title: (26540) Alfaro -
description: Old car park (probably flooded therefore more functional) on the edge of the Ebro delta. Shaded in a few places. Picnic table in a shelter. Dirt road to get there. Calm and quiet place. Nobody with us because not referenced on park4night.

title: (31591) Corella - 1.6-3 Calle D. Eduardo Hernández Asiaín
title_short: (31591) Corella - 1.6-3 Calle D. Eduardo Hernández Asiaín
description: Online parking in a new neighborhood. Quiet and close to the center.

title: (31514) Valtierra -
description: Quiet, wooded area, easily accessible for vans (branches too low for motorhomes) However, strong smell of fertilizer at times.

title: (26540) Alfaro - 21 Calle Junquera
description: Quiet place squares on asphalt or sand inside the trees. there are two swamps next door

title: (31592) Cintruénigo - 7 Calle Ramón Resa
description: On Avda. De España. Public parking, close to supermarkets and laundry and parks with swings for children and seniors.

title: (26540) Alfaro - 60 Avenida de Zaragoza
description: Authorized online parking on a street wide enough to maneuver with a camper. five minutes walk from the Collegiate where nesting more than 100 nests of storks is the nearest, you can park in town and comfortable to then leave and enter the city of Alfaro without problems. I do not think it's a good place to spend the night because of the noise of the road and because it is not well leveled

title: (31500) Navarra - C. Vuelta Poligono de Tiro
title_short: (31500) Navarra - C. Vuelta Poligono de Tiro
description: Space to make a stop. We ate here before starting the route. It is a wide space. There was a motorhome also

title: (26540) Alfaro - 2 Calle Ramón Almazán
description: Online parking. Quiet. Corner with street sto.domingo of the road. Green zone nearby in case you travel with a dog.

title: (31514) Valtierra - Unnamed Road
description: Ideal for sleeping, calm in the middle of the fir trees with an unobstructed view. Only downside can be the noise of the wind turbines which are not far away

title: (31515) Cadreita - Unnamed road
description: Car parks with picnic areas where we stop to eat. Next to the road and without any services. There is space for about 5 or 6 motorhomes.

title: (26540) Alfaro - 29 Avenida de Zaragoza
description: Street with several parking lots that can get you out of trouble. We parked for the day and eat out. Without any problem.

title: (26540) Alfaro - Calle la Perdiz
description: Residential area. Online parking next to Rio and green area. Quiet even on the weekend.

title: (26540) Alfaro - Avenida del Ebro
description: Paved parking with garbage cans and water source

title: (31592) Cintruénigo - N-113, Carretera Valtierra - Ágreda
description: No service. We spent one night without problem

title: (26540) Alfaro - Avenida del Ebro
description: Parking of the recreational area with trees and tables (there is a fountain but now it does not work) It is close to the Soto de la Nava viewpoint, which is also in this guide, but it is quieter and less traveled, much better if you go there with dogs.

title: (31500) Cabaña de Pericote - Unnamed Road
description: Place next to the road for a break, with a nice view over the natural park. The road to it is a gravel path, easy to drive on.

title: (31500) - Carretera Vuelta Polígono de Tiro
description: In the middle of the Bardenas desert, at the foot of the Castil de Tierra. Not necessarily very flat. All around the slopes, many spots to settle also. Highly compacted and practicable dirt road for any vehicle, crossings possible, no risk of stagnation even after rainy days. 4.5km from the Tourist Information Center, Tudela and its shops about thirty minutes drive. Absolutely no service, it's the desert! Beautiful view, total calm, soothing! Night prohibited on site, dislodged by the Rangers at 19h. Possible to sleep in the parking lot of the information center.

title: (31500) - Carretera Vuelta Polígono de Tiro
description: Good views, good place to stop and eat with the views of the Bardenas.

title: (31540) Buñuel - Unnamed Road
description: Large open space on the banks of the Ebro. Access by a dirt road to take at the exit of bunuel. Directions for hiking trails, running alongside the allotment gardens. No service.

title: (26540) Alfaro - Avenida del Ebro
description: Nice quiet place to spend the night and with a very good view

title: (31540) Buñuel - C.P. de las Damas
description: Urban site for up to 8 RVs next to a playground and picnic area. Recommended by the municipal police.

title: (31530) Cortes - Autovía del Ebro
description: Rest area of the N232 as it passes through Navarra With ample green area, bathrooms, tables ... Car noise Good for overnight

title: (31500) Navarra - Camino las Bardenas Reales
description: Beautiful place to spend the day.

title: (50500) Tarazona - 10 Avenida de la Paz
description: Quiet site and close to everything. In the same street supermarkets and restaurants.

title: (31500) Cabaña de Pericote -
description: Beautiful place in the middle of nowhere. Amazing views, totally quiet. Prohibited for overnight stays.

title: (50500) Tarazona - 14 Calle Cortes de Aragón
description: Wide and level plot, it is next to the Health Center. Without shade, it seems to be quiet and I don't think there will be any problem staying overnight. No forbidden sign

title: (50500) Tarazona - 31 Avenida de la Estacion
description: Parking at the Via Verde. From here you can start directly by bike or hiking.

title: (31500) Bardenas Reales - Carretera Vuelta Polígono de Tiro
title_short: (31500) Bardenas Reales - Carretera Vuelta Polígono de Tiro
description: Panoramic view of the desert ideal for small lunch break

title: (50548) El Buste - 39 Calle Mayor
description: Area to empty gray water and water fountain Free. There are 2 parking spaces but they are very small. Parking at the entrance of the town

title: (31513) Arguedas -
description: Small car park in front of a refuge, beautiful view of the desert, for a photo break and lunch.

title: (31513) Arguedas -
description: In the middle of the bardenas, a magnificent place to stop and eat in peace! Overnight stay prohibited!

title: (31500) - 2 N-121
description: Picnic area with stone tables. Car noise, but not too much.

title: (50500) Tarazona - 17 Avenida Navarra
description: Laundry

title: (50540) Borja - CV-846
description: Balcony of El Buste, very quiet at night despite the proximity of wind turbines (much less noisy than the edge of a road), with a breathtaking view of the Moncayo and Bardenas Reales. A little passage during the day to admire the panorama. 2 benches, but no trash. Paragliding off the other side of the road.

title: (50548) El Buste -
description: Via park4night we found the place across the road, but we found it too close to the street. We turned onto a side road off the main road a few yards away and then followed a tractor track for a few yards. It is off road but flat and certainly doable for bus campers. It burned here in August 2022 and the traces are still visible. It was completely silent at night, except for the background hum of the windmills. You sit on top of a plateau so you have a beautiful view.

title: (50500) Tarazona - 1 Calle Gutiérrez de Córdoba
description: I am from Tarazona and I recommend this free public parking to park your vehicles and visit this beautiful city. The car park is located in the center, right next to the cathedral but is accessed from its rear through the street where the school of Nuestra Señora del Pilar is located. I do not recommend it for very large vehicles. It has no services but it is a very quiet place to spend the night.

title: (31330) Cadreita - N-121
description: Small nice place by the side of the road to stop and eat nothing extraordinary but small fountain with water basin (marsh)

title: (31593) Fitero - 43K Calle Lejalde
description: Water service. Gray void and black water. In the parking lot is a little more isolated next to the winery and the park. Places, 10 plus or minus. Located next to the river and the picnic area in the shade.

title: (31500) Cabaña de Pericote - Camino las Bardenas Reales
title_short: (31500) Cabaña de Pericote - Camino las Bardenas Reales
description: 20m from the Bardenas piste. An extraordinary view to the North. You are in the Parc des Bardenas, so no night is possible.

title: (50500) Tarazona - 42 Calle la Fuente
description: Parking at the foot of Tarazona nice place and close to the city center

title: (50548) El Buste - Calle San Roque
description: At the bust follow the paragliding track and climbing-leave the paragliding aside and follow the path to the climbing site - firs for shade - a magnificent view and absolute calm - a little bit windy  but we manage to hide in the shelter ... pretty !!

title: (50500) Tarazona - 8A Calle Cinco Villas
description: A magnificent place completely paved and flat that the city of Tarazona offers us. In the back of the Civil Guard barracks and 10 minutes from the historic center. Supermarket 300 meters. It is a beautiful city to visit .... highly recommended ....

title: (31500) - Camino las Bardenas Reales
description: Beautiful place in the desert area, great views, possible hikes, etc. We spent the day here. Forbidden to sleep in the whole natural park area.

title: (31320) Milagro - NA-134
description: Restful picnic area no water source, but ideal for eating and visiting the region rich in cherries.

title: (26528) Valverde - N113
description: Next to the "Area de servicing Valverde". truck stop parking large area on both sides of the road with the services approx 50m away. the ground is a bit rough but generally flat and a little bit of rubbish about, but good enough for an overnight stop. toilets available for customers in the services

title: (50540) Borja - Unnamed Road
description: A small spot in a pine forest hidden from the road and winds. The access along the trail is fairly easy  and you can find numerous other spots with even easier access allong the same dirt road.

title: (50548) Borja - 13 Calle Número Dos Sant Miser
title_short: (50548) Borja - 13 Calle Número Dos Sant Miser
description: After a good hour of struggling, we decided to go see the Sanctuario de la Misercordia. Wow what a nice surprise! A picnic area where we were alone (arrived at 9 p.m.). A superb view of the valley. Very clean and a priori very quiet. In my opinion difficult access for motorhomes, because not wide (but at least 10 places for vans and pick-ups). No service apart from garbage cans. Superb view and cool under the pines.

title: (50548) Santuario de Misericordia -
description: Large spot under the trees. Flat surface and no services. Quiet at night and no light pollution, so perfect for watching stars.

name: Camping Bardenas
title: (31330) Camping Bardenas
description: Villafranca, Carretera de Villafranca. Camping Bardenas. Camping near the natural park of Bardenas. Excellent services but located between the road and the railway track. Swimming pool, cafeteria, grocery, pleasing bathroom. Price quite high.

title: (50513) Grisel - 34 Calle San Antón

description: Perfect for resting or eating.

name: Ecocamping Borja
title: (50548) Ecocamping Borja

title: (50660) Tauste - Unnamed Road

title: (50530) Novillas - CV-4
description: Small space at the edge of the water, just next to the bridge. peaceful to eat, to see to spend the night

title: (31500) Caparroso - Camino las Bardenas Reales
description: The Caparroso fair reservoir. Quiet place with trails for walking and mountain biking. There is a restaurant. No car services.

title: (50550) Mallén - 7 Camino Calveta
description: A place of passage, to sleep peacefully. especially recommending Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. They are the car parks of a warehouse and a center that looks like a sports center, outside the town. It has no shade and it is asphalt. nearby there is an esplanade with some trucks.

title: (50660) Tauste - Unnamed Road
description: Parking of the Sancho Abarca Sanctuary near the Bardenas near Plan de la Negra

title: (50617) Ejea de los Caballeros - Camino las Bardenas Reales
title_short: (50617) Ejea de los Caballeros - Camino las Bardenas Reales
description: Great view, very isolated.

title: (50617) - Camino las Bardenas Reales
description: Small room for one vehicle. You will have a magnificent view of the plain plana de la Negra. I recommend this parking only for VAN vehicles because too small for a motorhome. Ideal to spend a quiet night in the countryside !!

title: (50513) Grisel - Unnamed Road
description: Site with the best possible views of Moncayo. Located in a windmill cordal. Without any service. Very quiet road. We did not sleep here, but when we went back we liked the place and when we return to the area we will sleep here for sure. I add this point because the truth is that we have not liked much the options that there are in the area and it is the kind of place that we would have liked to find.

title: (50513) Los Fayos - 6 CV-639
description: Large recent quiet car park 400m from the center.

title: (50513) Los Fayos - 5 CV-639
description: Small nice place where we were allowed to set up tables and chairs on the meadow in front. The village is very pretty, with narrow streets and lovingly designed house entrances. You can visit the caves or climb 330 steps to the top of the rocks. We recommend the bar in the village with a nice outdoor area where you can have fun. The residents were very friendly to us. The only downer is the somewhat difficult access to the parking lot via app. But overall highly recommended if you want to experience the original Spain. **To access the Aire you must download the PVerde app from Google Play or Apple. Once registered, you can pay through the app and get the lock code. It is possible to pay in advance before your arrival. After the payment you will receive the lock code. The boarding block is on the left side of the barrier and is not visible when you are seated in the vehicle. Bring euro coins if you need electricity. If you are not lucky enough to find the space next to the power socket, you will need very long cables. It's 35m of cable to reach the second point.

title: (50617) Valareña - Calle Alegría
description: Small parking for 5 motorhomes. Water, quiet for the night

title: (50617) Valareña - 12 Calle Isabel Catolica Valareña
description: Water point open even in winter, compared to the air of cc or it is closed. faucet on the small place next to the bench

title: (50617) Valareña - 2 Calle de Joaquín Costa
description: Water point - not indicated if the water is drinkable

title: (31330) Villafranca - 14 Calle Castillo
description: Cement parking and completely leveled, has a pole with water.

title: (50513) Los Fayos - Unnamed Road
description: Parking next to the dam with a view of the valley, lots of other places along the very passable track

title: (50694) Pinsoro - 1 Calle Valtuerta
description: Parking in a village near the Bardenas desert; shade, picnic tables and water point. Watch out for mosquitoes!

title: (50694) Pinsoro - 4 Calle Prosperidad Pinsoro
description: Water point with tap on the children's playground!

title: (50694) Pinsoro - 1 Calle Acuerdo Pinsoro

address.street: Calle Planas Altas / Calle del Arco

title: (50669) Sancho Abarca -
description: Place in the middle of nature. Very quiet location. Great to spend a night. Beautiful sunrise in the morning. Unfortunately a lot of flies

title: (50540) Borja - 34 Calle Justicia de Aragón
description: Asphalted parking inside the city

title: (50540) Borja - 11T Avenida del Canto Coral
description: Large unpaved esplanade next to the health center and municipal sports center with heated pool in winter and outdoor pool in summer, gym, tennis courts ... there is a water source. Quiet area 5 minutes from the city center.

title: (50580) Vera de Moncayo - 85 Z-372
description: Parking next to the municipal swimming pools on the outskirts of the town of Vera. Fairly level dirt field with good access.

title: (50540) Borja - 2 Carretera de Ainzón
description: Water tap and free tire inflation at the gas station

title: (31330) Villafranca - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful place! not that easy to get to but definitly worth to find the way. No people around. No noise besides water river sounds. Little paradise.

title: (31330) Villafranca - Unnamed Road
description: Spot next to the river. Very quiet and beautiful views. In the morning, the locals that passed on their sunday walk were friendly

title: (50546) Bulbuente - 11 Calle Matilde Castro
description: Bulbuente swimming pools parking. You can access the pool where there is a bar, toilets, showers, swimming pools and a paddle tennis court. Ideal starting point for mountain biking, running, motocross routes to places like La Mora Encantada, La Muela, Climb to the Santuario de la Misericordia (famous Ecce Homo), Monastery of Veruela and Moncayo. It is not an area, not even a parking lot; It is an area of land next to the pool and the paddle tennis courts.

title: (26550) Rincón de Soto - 77 Diseminado Rincon Soto
title_short: (26550) Rincón de Soto - 77 Diseminado Rincon Soto
description: Flat car park near the Ebro River with paths and routes for both walking and cycling. It is a park with tables to eat and very quiet on the outskirts of a town. In less than 2km is the town with all services. Ideal to go with children and animals.

title: (31360) Funes - Unnamed Road
description: Camping spot in the countryside, at the edge of the river. Access by a small path (minimum ground clearance required), the ground is pebble. In the shelter of the wind, shaded spots. Frankly, little paradise

title: (50583) Trasmoz - 2 Edificio Diseminados
description: Free motorhome area at the moment, you only pay for electricity. Access to the left of the beautiful TRAMOZ panel. The road up to the camping area is rough road and need to keep moving up the steep path.

title: (50583) Trasmoz - 6 Edificio Diseminados
description: Easy access parking, perfect for visiting the town and castle

title: (50583) Trasmoz - 34 Calle Corazón de Jesús
description: Free water fountain in front of the church

title: (50549) Albeta - 4 Calle Estación
description: Very pleasant environment for families, with many possibilities for excursions in the open air, visit the Moncayo natural park, the Sanctuary of Mercy and the ecce homo, visit nearby towns such as Borja, Tarazona.

name: Camping Moncayo
title: (50580) Camping Moncayo
description: The quiet campsite is located on the outskirts with a beautiful view. The sanitary buildings are old but clean. Restaurant/ bar opens from June 1st. Owner very friendly.

title: (50581) Lituénigo - 6 Calle San Miguel
description: Quiet parking to spend the night and climb the Moncayo. fountain, bar and little shop in the next street. Only for vans. Very friendly inhabitants. There is a short hike out of town. we have spent a night without problem.

title: (31330) Villafranca -
description: Flat place along a forest path. Very quiet for the night. There is a river nearby as well as the start of the steps. The path is not suitable for large vehicles because it is narrow and dented

title: (50570) Ainzón - 6C Calle Manzano
description:
Free parking in public parking
about five or six places in a motorhome if the cars allow it a little fair with a well-leveled cement floor
right in the center of town with bars to snack, bakeries, shops, etc.
the black unloading area is a grid that must be raised before unloading

title: (50570) Ainzón - 20-22 Carretera Borja-Rueda
description: Parking for sleep and eat without problem and can give a tour of the village. Next borja and the ecce homo and close to the Moncayo. Perfect for rest. There is not water or services but very quiet.

title: (31360) Funes - Unnamed road
description: Be careful that around March April it is flooded. Beautiful place, with a river next to it, a pebble beach. Easy access with a van

title: (50520) Albeta - Avenida Reino de Aragón
description: Next to a peaceful park. Perfect place for an overnight stop on your journey across Spain. Water tap with good pressure just next to the adjacent playground.

title: (50520) Magallón - Avenida Zaragoza
description: Shaded picnic and a small river at the entrance of the village. We did not spend the night but we were alone. Maybe the weekend will change the atmosphere. Dirt floor with trees, ideal for campers and small motorhomes. A cycle route passes ahead. The town 10 minutes walk.

title: (50592) Vera de Moncayo - Z-373
description: Next to the Monastery of Veruela and at the foot of the Moncayo. You can spend the night quietly and there is good shade. The place is quiet and the views are beautiful. There is a bar that opens early and at 10 a few tourists start arriving. There are routes to walk

title: (50581) Lituénigo - 66 Calle Costanilla B
description: Lituenigo, a town in the foothills of the Moncayo. clay parking next to the municipal swimming pool

title: (31340) Marcilla - Avenida Complejo Deportivo
description: Service area. Close to sports fields Very good reception and security for the night since the gate closes automatically at 10 p.m. with the possibility of opening it with a code if necessary. Shower. Impossible to connect to Wifi, even at the bar.

title: (31380) Caparroso -
description: Lugar tranquilo

title: (26520) Cervera del Río Alhama - 12A Camino del Cementerio
title_short: (26520) Cervera del Río Alhama - 12A Camino del Cementerio
description: Good space for nine motorhomes with a slight slope, a complete water change area. Very new. The trees will still not shade in 2020. Close to the city and great views. Calm

title: (50694) Sádaba - Unnamed Road
description: Great place. We recommend 100%

title: (50694) - Calle Vicarodacha
description: Superb area, parking under the pines in the grass. The big lake is a few meters away, it is a bird sanctuary. No services except trash and children's games. Absolute tranquility, swimming prohibited.

title: (31360) Funes -
description: Public parking in the middle of nature. Outings of hiking and mountain biking routes. Barranco de Peñalen one of the 7 wonders of Navarra.

title: (50500) Tarazona - SO-382
description: Quiet spot on the edge of the pond and remove from the road with views of the valley and the mountains. We do not want to leave.

title: (50547) Bureta - 14 Carretera de Borja
description: Ample shared parking with cars at the entrance of the town, ideal for parking and visiting the Enchanted Forest and / or eating. Maybe also spend the night, because, despite being on the edge of the road, there is hardly any traffic. Bakery one step away.

title: (31380) Caparroso - 62 Avenida de Navarra
description: It is a public car park, for about 10 vehicles in a quiet place among trees. It has tables and benches next to it to eat. All the services that I describe are located in the town. Everything within walking distance.

title: (31500) Tudela - Camino las Bardenas Reales
description: Nice flat and super quiet place near an agricultural road in Bardenas Reales. PLEASE respect nature and the environment and leave nothing behind. Bring your trash with you with amazing memories.

title: (50547) Bureta - 20 Diseminado Afueras
description: Park and sports courts with picnic tables and good shade. nearby is the Magical Park of Bureta. the little ones liked it a lot

name: Área autocaravanas Alberite de San Juan
title: (50529) Área autocaravanas Alberite de San Juan
title_short: (50529) Área autocaravanas Alberite de San Juan
description: Free service area that includes a sanitary block with 1 toilet and 1 shower (cold and without lock). Black waste flows into the gray waste disposal drain. Dishwasher and bins. Well distributed with 15 marked flat plots. On the outskirts of a pretty village with country views, a small bar nearby and a bakery only open 10-11am. every day and a municipal pool ask at the bar to enter

title: (31315) Murillo el Cuende - Unnamed Road
description: Parking ruins of an ancient fortified village XII, entry 2 euros very interesting, perfect for a break, parking sloping or flatter just before the earth

title: (31380) Caparroso - 8 Calle el Ferial
description: New car park near the football stadium, no ban for CCs. We stopped for lunch. Not tested at night

title: (31340) Marcilla - 2 Calle el Cid
description: Perfect parking to visit Marcilla, we arrived by chance, because it was a party and the A/C was closed. We have slept peacefully, Friday night in full parties.

title: (31380) Caparroso - 47 Avenida de Pamplona
description: A place to park and spend the night with picnic tables among young trees that do not give much shade, some swings for children. There is a gas station that is 200 m. walk, has a bar-restaurant

title: (50561) Bisimbre - N-122
description: Small rest area next to the road. It has tables and benches and trees.

title: (31380) Caparroso - Unnamed road
description: Very clean shower and WC accessible at the CEPSA gas station. Just ask for the keys at the station reception. a restaurant is available next door if you want to eat or drink a coffee. We were able to fill our thermos with coffee :)

title: (31380) Caparroso -
description: Good place and good views and with the river next to it

title: (31360) Funes -
description:
Super spot on a ridge with a 360 view of the valley next to a small chapel. Beautiful sunset/sunrise.

You can find the water point when you walk to Jesus via the left side.

Also great area for mountain biking.

title: (31360) Funes -
description:
Parking and field next the a cemetery. Has trash containers. Large fields next to to have a view.

Great area for mountain biking, there are many single track trails.

title: (31380) Caparroso - 2 Camino Cementerio
description: A car park next to a hermitage. Garden with picnic tables, fountain, swings for children, trees with plenty of shade in summer.

title: (26531) Aguilar del Río Alhama - LR-284
description: Parking of the celtiberico deposit. Closed on Monday, by the Alhama River, there are swimming pools nearby. Without services of any kind.

title: (31360) Funes - 5 Paseo de La Mejana
description: Dirt parking near the river. many mosquitoes

title: (31382) Mélida - 31A Calle Fueros
